title: Mobile Video Surveillance Market Set to Reach Over USD 4.5 Billion by 2030, Driven by Robust 8.7% CAGR Growth from 2023 | Taiwan News | Jul. 31, 2025 03:50
text:
The global mobile video surveillance market, valued at approximately USD 2.4 billion in 2022, is projected to grow at a healthy CAGR of more than 8.7% during the forecast period from 2023 to 2030. Mobile video surveillance involves the use of mobile devices such as vehicles or drones to capture and transmit video footage. It finds extensive applications across transportation, industrial, military, law enforcement, and other sectors.

This technology enables remote monitoring and enhances situational awareness, contributing significantly to public safety and asset protection.
Market Drivers
- Adoption of Software Analytics and AI: Increasing integration of software analytics and artificial intelligence (AI) enhances the efficiency and effectiveness of mobile video monitoring systems.
- Rise in Smart Devices Usage: Growing use of smart devices for wireless remote monitoring supports the demand for mobile video surveillance solutions.
- Integration with Access Control and Alarm Systems: Increasing integration of mobile video surveillance with access control and alarm systems improves security measures.
- Smart City Initiatives: Government initiatives aimed at developing smart cities drive the deployment of mobile video surveillance systems for efficient urban management and public safety.
Market Challenges
- Privacy and Security Concerns: Issues related to data security and privacy in wireless camera systems pose challenges to market growth.
- High Storage and Bandwidth Requirements: The need for high-capacity storage systems and bandwidth for transmitting video data limits widespread adoption.

Regional Insights
- North America: Dominated the market in 2022 owing to high crime rates, extensive deployment of surveillance equipment, and increasing demand for cloud-based mobile video surveillance solutions.
- Asia Pacific: Expected to witness the highest CAGR during the forecast period due to rising adoption of flexible mobile video surveillance solutions and increasing deployment in the transportation sector.
